page.title: 01Kielder & Ridge End Burns
page.content: This Grid block has as its main feature the valleys of the Kielder Burn and Ridge End Burn. These burns have cut deep valleys in the moorland, most of which is now clothed in coniferous woods planted by the Forestry Commission. The Farm at{East Kielder}is the only settlement in the area, and the only access is by forestry road. This road, which connects{Kielder village}and {Byrness}is open to the public as a Forest Drive. As yet the ridges of{Three Pikes}and {Hogswood Moor}stand clear of the forest, with heather and mossy beds surmounted by a series of small stone cairns.
